summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Delaware Division of Corporations, requesting all records related to the corporate entity L.S.J, LLC. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal statutes including sex trafficking and conspiracy, and includes a confidentiality request and a declaration form for the custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the cover letter requesting confidentiality for the grand jury subpoena issued to the Delaware Division of Corporations.

persons.name: Geoff E. Becan
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena dated August 9, 2019, demanding records for L.S.J, LLC.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to the Delaware Division of Corporations for records related to L.S.J, LLC.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the Delaware Division of Corporations to appear before the grand jury, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

locations: Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
State of Delaware Division of Corporations, 401 Federal Street, Suite #4, Dover, DE 19901
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, Squad C-40, New York, NY 10278
6100 Red Hook Quarter Suite B-3, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands 00802 (address for L.S.J, LLC)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement for illegal sexual activity).
The target of the subpoena is L.S.J, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company with an address in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, incorporated on or about April 17, 1998.

The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests the Delaware Division of Corporations to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

The requested records include all corporate documents such as certificates of incorporation, business addresses, service of process addresses, and identifying information on directors, officers, and owners.
The document shows the investigation was active and using grand jury powers as of August 2019, focusing on corporate entities potentially linked to the criminal activity under investigation.
